content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Implement AS MANY new ideas as you can as PopeBot skills in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). For EACH skill: create the SKILL.md, write the implementation code, and write and run a test to prove it works. Do not stop at one skill â€” keep going until you run out of good ideas or time. After you have built and tested everything, use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a comprehensive progress report listing every skill you built, your test results for each, and code samples.

content.thinking:
This is an exciting task! I need to:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Implement as many new skills as possible in the .pi/skills/ directory
3. For each skill: create SKILL.md, write implementation code, and test it
4. Send an email report to winsorllc@yahoo.com with all findings

Let me start by exploring these repositories to understand what's available. I'll need to clone or fetch information from each repo.

Let me begin by examining what's already in the .pi/skills directory to understand the current skill structure, then explore the three repositories.

content.thinking:
Good, I can see the existing skills structure. Now I need to scan the three GitHub repositories mentioned to find new tools, skills, and architectures. Let me clone them and examine their contents.

Let me start by cloning the repositories to examine them:
1. https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw
2. https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw
3. https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot

I'll use git to clone them temporarily.

arguments.command: cd /job/tmp && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw 2>&1 | tail -5
